Wadsworth was founded in 1814 and was named after General Elijah Wadsworth, a hero of the Revolutionary War. The Wadsworth City School District is known for success in athletics, the arts, and academics.

value: Wadsworth is located just off of I-76 which runs from west of Akron east to New Jersey.
Historical Downtown District with picturesque Gazebo in the town square.
Relax at one of Wadsworth's beautiful parks
Shop at one of the many shops in the picture perfect downtown district.
Blue Sky Drive-in is one of the few remaining drive-in movie theatres in Ohio. It is located on the east side of town and shows first run movies all summer long.
"Bidinger's Ice Cream" is one of the most popular ice cream stands in the area.
"Blue Sky Drive-In" is one of the few remaining drive-in movie theatres in Ohio. It is located on the east side of town and shows first run movies all summer long.
"Casa Del Rio" serves delicious Mexican food and is located in the Great Oaks Area
"The Sub Station" is a train themed American restaurant located in the downtown district.
"Whole Day Cafe" in the downtown district offers crepes, tea, coffee, and other pastries.
"Ritzman's Pharmacy" is located across from City Hall in the downtown district and offers a large variety of smoothies for the health conscious at their smoothie bar.
